short_summary: Replace gate heater and electrical cabling at Dam 11
description: The Contract involves replacement of Gate Heater and associated electrical cabling at Dam 11 within Trent-Severn Waterway. The Engineer in charge of the Work will not have any lien or personal gain on such award. The full tender documents may be collected from Government Electronic Tendering Service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. Addenda, when issued, can be downloaded free from the Government Tendering Service. Late bids will not be considered.
full_summary:
**Tender Announcement #5P468-23-0189: Stage 1 - Dam 11 Radial Gates Electrical Modifications**
------------------------------

**Notice Type**: Invitation to Qualify

**Procurement Category**: CNST

**Solicitation Number**: 5P468-23-0189

**Closing Date**: October 24, 2023, 14:00:00

**Estimated Contract Value**: $250,001 - $500,000

**Contracting Agency**: Parks Canada

**Project Location**: Trent-Severn Waterway National Historic Site

**Project Description**: Parks Canada requires the replacement of gate and gain heaters, and associated electrical cabling, at two (2) radial gates - Dam 11. This project is estimated to be valued between $250,001 and $500,000, inclusive of taxes.

**Evaluation Criteria**: The selection of the qualified supplier will be based on the Lowest Price criteria.

**Procurement Method**: Competitive - Traditional

**Contract Duration**: The expected contract start date is November 6, 2023, and the expected contract end date is January 31, 2024.

**Submission Instructions**: Bidders are required to submit their applications electronically via email or fax. The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Bids submitted by email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca will not be accepted.

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries**: All technical and contractual enquiries should be submitted to the Contracting Authority in writing and should be received no later than five (5) business days prior to the closing date.

**Additional Information**: National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act. Bidders must ensure that they have sufficient expertise to perform the required work.

**Attachments**: The following documents are attached to this notice:

* Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for Stage 1
* Example of Invitation to Tender (ITT) for Stage 2

Note to Bidders: The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Late submissions will not be considered. Bidders must review and comply with all terms and conditions of the solicitation document. Please ensure that you have sufficient expertise and resources to perform the required work.

Contact Information:

* Name: Ryan Jones
* Email: ryan.j
